job_history.work_description: Arrange efficient and orderly admission of patients. Insures that patient information is collected and that patients are aware of hospital policies and procedures. Interview incoming patient or representative and enter information required for admission into computer database. Collect co-pays and deductibles from patients. Distribute appropriate information to ancillary departments. Cross trained in other areas and perform any other duties as assigned (OP and IP).

Interviewing clients in a hospital setting and/or home visits to assist them in obtaining maximum benefit coverage. Completing applications for state and federal program, reviewing medical records and taking all actions necessary to expedite benefit approval. Maintain ongoing communications with government agencies regarding the status of claims. Provide updates and assistance to hospital personnel and other staff as needed.

Provide direct care and training for developmentally disabled and/or mentally retarded (DD/MR), ambulatory and non-ambulatory individuals at the Utah State Developmental Center. Properly manage aggressive, self-abusive, and non-compliant individuals. Implement and follow prescribed behavioral programs. Transfer individuals correctly. Perform direct care services to include: bathing, showering, dressing, toileting or changing incontinent briefs (diapering), oral hygiene, feeding.

Update and maintain client charts with medical services. Meet with treatment team (psychiatrist, MFT's and Psychologists) to discuss clients treatment plan. Facilitate STEP group for clients parents. Facilitate Anger Management groups for Clients. Coordinate client services with local agencies. Provide rehab services to medication only clients 1x/month. Provide interpretations to Spanish as needed to facilitate access to services. Home-visits. Parent and family support. Intense Case management. Attend clinic meetings. Participate as a tx team member. Facilitated daily groups for the Intense outpatient and inpatient program clients.

education.university: University of Utah College of Social Work

skills.name: Patient Admission
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience with patient admission processes, including collecting patient information, entering data into computer databases, and distributing information to ancillary departments.

skills.name: Customer Service
skills.explanation: Has provided excellent customer service in various healthcare settings, including interviewing patients, answering questions, and resolving issues.

skills.name: Data Entry
skills.explanation: Has experience with data entry, including entering patient information into computer databases and maintaining accurate records.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has excellent communication skills, including verbal and written communication, and has experience communicating with patients, families, and healthcare professionals.

skills.name: Case Management
skills.explanation: Has experience with case management, including coordinating services with local agencies, providing support to patients and families, and facilitating access to services.

skills.name: Group Facilitation
skills.explanation: Has experience facilitating groups, including anger management groups and support groups for patients and families.

skills.name: Crisis Intervention
skills.explanation: Has experience with crisis intervention, including managing aggressive and self-abusive individuals and providing support during emergencies.

skills.name: Social Work
skills.explanation: Has a Master's degree in Social Work and has extensive experience working in social work settings, including hospitals, clinics, and community organizations.

skills.name: Spanish Interpretation
skills.explanation: Has experience providing Spanish interpretation services to facilitate access to services for patients and families.
